revised_title: Ariel 4 Satellite Observations of Low Energy Electron Intensities in Auroral Zones
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using the Ariel 4 satellite to study the angular distributions of low energy electron intensities in the auroral zones. They discovered two distinct zones of electron intensities: the low-altitude signature of plasma sheet electron intensities and the more intense, structured region of inverted V events. These findings provide insights into the mechanisms behind auroral phenomena and the behavior of charged particles in the Earth's magnetosphere.
